website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a network music player packed with features and sparkling audio, then the Marantz NA7004 is a one-stop shop.
pros: AirPlay makes wireless iPhone connection easy
cons: No network support for Apple Lossless

customer_reviews.title: Impressed me big time!
customer_reviews.text: I bough this unitbfor a friend, so i had he chance to play with it for a month before bringing it t him in Canada, I compared with PS audio PWD MKI and Hegel HD11, Marantz was so pleasant to listen too via my macbook with aiff files that it got me really impressed. I also like the flexibility with internet radio, it was sooo good thatt three of my friends bough one, and i ended up getting one for myself go figure. Latest Marantz network player $4k, yes. Got mine at $399 greatest bargain in audio today.
customer_reviews.author: Ulices Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Why does Europe get more features?
customer_reviews.text: The NA7004 delivers remarkable sound quality from internet radio, streaming and iPhones. I already had a good experience with the unit in Europe. My only disappointment with the American version is the lack of an FM tuner and digital radio.
customer_reviews.author: joeldr

customer_reviews.title: choices with cd quality
customer_reviews.text: We live near a mountain which limits FM reception. This NA7004 effectively gives us unlimited choices. Example: we listened to classical music from Paris, reggae from the Cayman Islands and a load of other things. The bonus is many local stations come in, including am radio, and all are Cd quality.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Walker

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have it
customer_reviews.text: I did realize that the Marantz NA7004 is an important piece of my sound system. Now I have a tool to find music around the world, with good quality sound. I am very happy to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Castro

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. Current price makes this a bargain.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly a nice sounding DAC in addition to its ability to stream audio from a NAS. You also get a free upgrade from Marantz to use as an Airplay device in you use iTunes.
customer_reviews.author: Afridi

customer_reviews.title: Very good DAC/ Network player
customer_reviews.text: The beautiful sound of Marantz. So clear. A pleasure to listen to. Wonderful Internet Radio, tens of thousands of stations. Pandora and other services. Haven't tried it yet as a DAC for a digital source. Headphone amp very good. Overall highly recommended at the $399 price at Music Direct.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great Soundstage
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy. I use it with my "classic" Nakamichi SR4a from 1987, and M&K Satellite Ones w/sub from the same era. Wow. The soundstage is large, separation is good (not McIntosh quality, but good). I was looking for a DAC when I read the reviews on this unit. I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Renwick Congdon

customer_reviews.title: My husband won't leave it alone! Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We enjoy good music, and have a great surround sound system, but needed this to compliment the components we have. Sound is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Sheree Brody

customer_reviews.title: Marantz NA7004
customer_reviews.text: The unit would not stay on when the on button was used. The button would flash and the unit would immediately shut down. Had to return it. Was really disappointed. Amazon was great with the return.
customer_reviews.author: Clasical Affectionado

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since the first CD player
customer_reviews.text: I waited until these became steeply discounted and wish I had not waited so long. Honestly, this is the coolest and most amazing audio piece I've purchased since the first CD player in the early 80's. I don't know how anyone could gripe about this at all. So what that it's not wireless? I'm glad it's not. Ever mess with a wireless printer??? What a nightmare. From the brilliant display to all the connections and features, I couldn't wish for anything better. Thank you Marantz for including the headphone jack and volume knob on the front. I like this so much I placed it on my nightstand next to my bed! And you know what bedside nightstands hold...
customer_reviews.author: S. Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: No Spotify?
customer_reviews.text: Only support Spotify through Airplay; I also purchase the receiver SR5007 and it has Spotify built-in; A major disappointment! The software/firmware updates happened frequently, hopefully they will update with Spotify...
customer_reviews.author: C. Wynn

customer_reviews.title: 24bit 192kHz support
customer_reviews.text: Actually J.White, it does decode 24bit 192kHz via digital in. It's the USB input that is limited to 24bit 96kHz so you should be able to enjoy your 24 192kHz music files. [...]
customer_reviews.author: K. Chaggar

product_meta.title: Marantz NA7004 Network Audio Player (Black)
product_meta.description: Network Audio Player, DLNA ver. 1.5 certified DMP (Digital Media Player) & DMR (Digital Media Renderer), Internet Radio(v Tuner), Online streaming service available: napster, PANDORA and Phapsody, Front USB(type A) input for music playback with iPod/iPhone digital connection or USB memory, Rear USB(Type B)/Optical/Coax digital inputs enable D/A converter mode for external music source, Rear inputs support high quality format files USB: up to 96kHz/24bit, Optiacl&Coaxial: up to 192kHz/24bit, Bluetooth capability with option RX101, Supporting WMA, MP3, MPEG 4 AAC, WAV and FLAC format files, iPhone/iPod Touch Apps Control, Discrete high quality analog audio circuits with marantz HDAM SA2, Hand held remote controller, Compatible with Windows7, Supporting UPnP,
feature_bullets: DLNA version 1.5 certified digital media player
Supports WMA, MP3, MPEG 4 AAC, WAV, FLAC
USB input with iPod digital interface, Internet radio
Discrete Symmetric circuit architecture with HDAM 2
D/A Converter Mode providing 3 digital inputs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars22 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
